keyword: how many calories in jack daniels
title: How Many Calories in Jack Daniels?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in Jack Daniels whiskey per standard shot, including alcohol content, zero carbs, and tips for mixers or servings.
h1: How Many Calories in Jack Daniels?
assumptions: Standard 40% ABV (80 proof) Tennessee whiskey; 1 shot = 1.5 fl oz (44 ml), served neat, no mixers or ice dilution.
disclaimer: Calories vary by proof, serving size, and mixers; alcohol content affects totals. Consult bottle labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One standard shot of Jack Daniels contains about 97 calories, all from alcohol with no carbs, protein, or fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison, noting alcohol provides empty calories.

tweaks.label: Mixed with 4 oz cola (adds ~40 kcal from soda)
Double shot (3 oz instead of 1.5 oz)
On the rocks (minimal dilution from ice melt)

faqs.q: How many calories in one shot of Jack Daniels?
faqs.a: Approximately 97 calories per 1.5 oz (44 ml) shot.

faqs.q: Does Jack Daniels have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugarsâ€”calories come solely from alcohol.

faqs.q: What about calories in Jack Daniels and Coke?
faqs.a: A standard mix adds ~40 kcal from 4 oz cola, totaling ~137 kcal.

faqs.q: How do calories change with proof or serving size?
faqs.a: Higher proof increases calories; larger servings like double shots double them to ~194 kcal.

faqs.q: Is Jack Daniels low-calorie compared to other whiskeys?
faqs.a: Similar to most 80-proof whiskeys at ~97 kcal per shot; varies slightly by brand.
